head.hi:
The Genuine Jew
Twice a week

div.p: We are delighted to announce to our readers and our friends that our hope with “The Genuine Jew”, to create a readership and be of use for our brothers, especially our pious brothers, was fulfilled. Already, after three issues of “The Genuine Jew”, our paper has gained popularity among the people. Starting on Thursday, people start to ask every tobacconist's, every bookstore and even the editor’s office, whether the new edition has already arrived. Our readers can barely wait until the print has finished. Everything is bought, for example, we have not a single copy left of No. 3, although we printed a huge batch.

Not only the news about the war made people interested in this paper. From all over, people tell us that the audience, especially our Orthodox brothers who are the reason we established the paper, are very satisfied. The articles mainly focusing on Jewish topics proved popular among the general public. For the first time, there is a Jewish newspaper in Galicia which every pious Jew can read, including his wife and children without having to fear to stray from the path of righteousness.
The audience is content with us and we are content with the audience. This mutual satisfaction allows us to improve and prosper our paper.

Voices from different quarters ask for the paper to be released daily, but we want to follow what our scholars of blessed memories have said: “If you grasp too much, you will grasp nothing” and not to put too much work on our backs. Therefore, we decided to first carry out a small test, namely: from next week on

The Genuine Jew
comes out twice a week
Tuesday and Friday

Friday will stay like it is now with the same content. On Tuesday, we will preliminarily write about news from the war front, politics and similar topics our readers care about and cannot wait for until Friday.

We live in serious times. More wars will follow the war between Russia and Japan. The whole world, generally the Jew, is curious to know what happens around the globe. And if there is no Jewish press he has to purchase newspapers in other languages which are more expensive and he might not understand them well. Therefore, if “The Genuine Jew” comes out twice a week, he will be able to satisfy his needs concerning a Jewish paper.

The price of our paper “The Genuine Jew”

div.head: The cultus elections in Lviv
div.p: In the first articles of three issues of “The Genuine Jew” various writers rightfully pointed at several important questions regarding Jewish existence which are not handled as they should be. The writers allude to our ample negligence of Jewry as in every nook we are pointing to in order to criticize. The upbringing of our children, our religious education, our rabbis; briefly speaking: at home, in school and even in the rabbis’ dwellings. Everywhere is room for improvements and every writer asks: Who is at fault?

Who is at fault? Answering this question is not easy because we are all guilty: our sons and our elders, young and old, we all are guilty that the Jewry is getting weaker and weaker. Our parents do not parent our children well. Our religion teachers teach badly. Even our rabbis do not have any power, any influence. It has to become better here. Because of the rabbinical question, are our rabbis without power or influence, they are dependent on our cultus board and therefore do not dare to open their mouth and demand for things to improve.

And here we come to our main conclusion to our question: Who is at fault? Guilty is our cultus board, the leaders of our communities. They are not taking a stance and act correctly according to their duty.
The communities act as autonomous bodies. This means they have the right to manage all affairs regarding their community on their own

without anyone intervening. In any other nation an autonomous entity like this would act in favour of its own people. It would use its force and influence to improve the prevailing conditions. Here however, it is different. Our ministry of cultural affairs mainly consists of mere chanceries. Books are taken care of, they stipulate how things should be running. There is an accountant, a cashier, and a controller. The council gets together every once in a while to talk about current matters, a bit about politics, about the Landtag elections and things like that. But they do not talk about Jewish matters, about the significant interests of the Jewish people - those are not discussed as if the council is not responsible for them.

The cause of this is very simple. In most Galician cities, the majority of Jews living there are pious ones. However, the electives in the ministry are mainly “progressive” lawyers who are not particularly interested in Jewish matters. Whenever this council gets together in a meeting, they are clueless what to do in favour of religion and faith. First of all, they do not know a lot about it and do not know how to enact a remedy. Secondly, they are more progressive and cannot act against their own opinion of Jewry. It is already sufficient if they do not do anything to harm Jewry as they are afraid of the pious populace. More than that, everything is neglected. The council does not care about the religious education, not about the rabbinical question, not about the תּלמוד־תּורה (Talmetoyre - a tuition-free elementary school maintained by the community for poor children), they do not care about Jewish upbringing. Therefore, everything here is foul and bad.

Why do we talk about this whole thing here? Shortly, there will be an election for the new board of culture in Lviv, the capital of the country. The smaller towns look up to the big city and adapt themselves towards it. The state of the big city has an influence on the small towns. If everything is working properly in the city, everything will be alright in the smaller cities. Moreover, elections in a big community, a community of major cultural and religious importance - like the one in Lviv - are significant for the whole country and have a bigger impact than just locally. The outcome of the elections can influence the entire country - for the better or for the worse. And we pious Jews need to see that it will be better.

We do not want to look into the programs and moreover single individuals and parties yet. There still will be enough time for that. Today we want to concern ourselves with the question in order to remind our pious brothers of the upcoming elections which are very important for the Jewry and
to call on them to pay their overdue taxes in order to not lose their right to vote. They should make an effort to attain as many votes as they can. For these elections, every vote has an immense value. This time they need to use their voice for the benefit of the true Jewry. If we manage to improve the situation in the ministry of culture and education, everything will gradually improve.
- The observer.

div.head:
Our daughter’s education.
II.
div.p: I must admit that the impression my first article on pious family has made, was bigger than I anticipated. This shows that I portrayed the situation correctly. The critique, what I have criticised was right therefore. However, it is not as easy to point a way to improve the conditions. The main action is for the parents to care more about their daughter’s education as much as they should stick to the rule: “One who is created needs to marry, but does not need to live”. This means: do only men need to live piously? Do only our sons need to be educated well, Jewish, and piously, but not our daughters? Women today play a big role in our family life. Not only is the Jewry at home, the kashrut, the desecration of Sabbath, amongst other things, dependent on them, because the men are busy making a living to take care of the household. They are not responsible for the children’s and particularly the daughter’s upbringing, but if their daughters are not educated Jewish, one can imagine them wanting to raise their daughters again. Still, the pious Jewry should strive to educate their daughters as well as their sons. They have to see that their daughter’s do not leave school which is a legal requirement which no one can withdraw from. They have to see that their daughter’s do not spend their days reading corrupt novels which turn them bad. They have to see that their daughter’s educate themselves economically, they should know cooking, baking, sewing, stitching and so on. It is necessary for every Jewish housewife to concern themselves with this matter if they do not want to deal with some blockhead, if they do not want to be associated with bad company, and to not be unhappy with themselves and make their parents miserable. If they strive for education and knowledge, they can gather enough Jewish knowledge. They can learn to understand our prayers and our poems, learn a bit of Jewish history, they need to know how much the Jewish people have suffered for their religion and their faith, how many martyrs have devoted themselves, were burnt and drowned for our holy religion. They therefore should be planted deep in the young hearts, love, and respect for their people, their religion, to their customs, and their performances. At that time, the honest, pious Jew has not been the target of mockery, at that time they were not looked at like people from past generations, at that time they felt what every pious Jew felt, back then they would know that they are

Jewish daughters, that they have Jewish duties. At that time, the old, magnificent Jewish family life could develop and it will be as it was written in the scripture: May peace dwell in your community and tranquillity in your homes!
